SEARCH
Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller

Klasse GameController

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.Controller
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Controller
The GameController class manages the Minesweeper gameplay, including UI, game logic, sound effects, and interactions with other components like leaderboard management and user data.

This class is responsible for handling the game loop, initializing the game board, managing player interactions, and determining win or loss conditions.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • GameController

      public GameController(String username, String difficulty, String style, boolean muted)
      Constructs a new GameController with the specified parameters.

      This constructor initializes the game controller with the given player username, game difficulty, style, and sound settings.

      Parameter:
      username - The username of the player.
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the game (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro").
      style - The visual style/theme of the game (e.g., "retro", "modern").
      muted - true if the game should be muted, false otherwise.

  • Methodendetails

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Starts the game by setting up the stage, initializing game elements, and configuring the game window.

      This method is the entry point for initializing a new game session. It sets default values, initializes user interface elements, starts background music (if not muted), and displays the main game window.

      Parameter:
      stage - The primary Stage on which the game is displayed.

    • setDefaultValues

      private void setDefaultValues()
      Resets the game state to its default values.

      This method initializes important game variables to ensure a clean slate when starting or restarting the game.

    • initializeWindow

      private void initializeWindow()
      Initializes and configures the main game window.

      This method sets up the root container, styles, and layout of the game window. It ensures that the window adjusts dynamically to the stage size and switches to the game scene.

    • restartGame

      private void restartGame()
      Restarts the game by creating a new GameController instance and starting a new game session.

      This method stops the background music and initializes a fresh game using the current player's username, selected difficulty, style, and mute settings.

    • endGame

      public void endGame(boolean won)
      Ends the current game and handles the endgame state based on whether the player won or lost.

      This method stops the game timer, background music, disables all game interactions, highlights incorrect flags, and triggers win or loss logic.

      Parameter:
      won - true if the player won the game, false if the player lost.

    • wonGame

      private void wonGame()
      Handles the logic for when the player wins the game.

      This method updates the player's best time, submits the best time to the leaderboard, updates the restart button to reflect the win, and transitions back to the menu after playing the victory sound (if not muted).

    • lossGame

      private void lossGame()
      Handles the logic for when the player loses the game.

      This method updates the restart button to reflect the loss, reveals unflagged bombs, and transitions back to the menu after playing sound effects (if not muted).

    • showIncorrectFlags

      private void showIncorrectFlags()
      Highlights incorrectly flagged cells on the game board.

      This method iterates through all cells and identifies those that are flagged but do not contain a bomb. These cells are marked with a "false-flag" icon and their button styles are updated to indicate they have been revealed.

    • updateBestTime

      private void updateBestTime()
      Updates the player's best time for the current difficulty level if the current time is better.

      This method loads the player's user data, compares the elapsed game time with the stored best time for the current difficulty, and updates it if the current time is faster. The updated data is then saved.

    • switchToMenu

      private void switchToMenu()
      Switches from the current game to the main menu.

      This method creates a new instance of the MenuController with the current player's settings (username, style, and mute status) and starts the main menu scene.

    • checkWinCondition

      public void checkWinCondition()
      Checks whether the player has won the game by revealing all non-bomb cells.

      This method iterates through all cells on the game board and determines if all cells that do not contain bombs have been revealed. If this condition is met, the game is ended with a win state.

    • initializeUserElements

      private void initializeUserElements()
      Initializes the user interface elements for the game.

      This method sets up the main components of the game's user interface, including the game information box (e.g., timer and flags) and the game field (grid of cells).

    • initializeGameInfoBox

      private void initializeGameInfoBox()
      Initializes the game information box that displays key gameplay information.

      This method sets up a horizontal box (`HBox`) to organize and display elements such as the remaining flags counter, restart button, and timer. Spacers are used to ensure proper alignment.

    • initializeRemainingFlagsCounterBox

      private void initializeRemainingFlagsCounterBox()
      Initializes the box displaying the remaining flags counter.

      This method creates a horizontal box (`HBox`) to hold the label showing the number of remaining flags. The box is styled and aligned for proper display.

    • initializeRemainingFlagsCounterLabel

      private void initializeRemainingFlagsCounterLabel()
      Initializes the label displaying the remaining flags count.

      This method creates a Label to show the number of remaining flags, applies styles to it, and sets its initial value based on the total number of mines.

    • updateRemainingFlagsCounter

      public void updateRemainingFlagsCounter()
      Updates the label displaying the number of remaining flags.

      This method calculates the number of remaining flags by subtracting the count of flagged cells from the total number of mines. It updates the label's text and styling accordingly. If the remaining flags count reaches zero, a click event listener is added to reveal all unflagged cells.

    • revealAllUnflaggedCellsWithSound

      private void revealAllUnflaggedCellsWithSound()
      Reveals all unflagged and unrevealed cells on the game board with sound effects.

      This method stops the background music, reveals all cells that are not flagged and have not been previously revealed, and determines whether the player has won or lost the game based on the revealed cells.

    • initializeRestartGameButton

      private void initializeRestartGameButton()
      Initializes the restart game button.

      This method creates and configures a button that allows the player to restart the game. It sets the button's style, initial state, and action handler for restarting the game.

    • updateRestartGameButton

      private void updateRestartGameButton(String status)
      Updates the appearance of the restart game button based on the game status.

      This method changes the text (emoji) displayed on the restart button to visually represent the current game state, such as a win, loss, nervousness, or default (neutral) state.

      Parameter:
      status - The current game status, which determines the button's emoji:
      • "win": Displays a sunglasses emoji ("😎") for a win.
      • "lose": Displays a dizzy face emoji ("😵") for a loss.
      • "nervous": Displays a nervous face emoji ("😯") for nervousness.
      • Any other value: Displays a smiling face emoji ("🙂") as the default state.

    • initializeTimerBox

      private void initializeTimerBox()
      Initializes the timer box that displays the elapsed time during the game.

      This method creates a horizontal box (`HBox`) to hold the timer label, aligns it at the center, and applies a style class for consistent styling.

    • initializeTimerLabel

      private void initializeTimerLabel()
      Initializes the label displaying the elapsed game time.

      This method creates a Label to show the current game timer, applies a style class for consistent styling, and adds the label to the timer box.

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer()
      Starts the game timer.

      This method initializes a Timeline that increments the elapsed game time every second and updates the timer label with the formatted time. The timer runs indefinitely until it is stopped.

    • stopTimer

      private void stopTimer()
      Stops the game timer.

      This method checks if the timer is running and stops it to prevent further updates to the elapsed game time.

    • initializeGameField

      private void initializeGameField()
      Initializes the game field based on the selected difficulty level.

      This method determines the number of rows, columns, and total mines for the game field based on the current difficulty setting. After determining these parameters, it calls initializeField to set up the field.

      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the difficulty level is not recognized.

    • initializeField

      private void initializeField(int rows, int columns)
      Initializes the game field with the specified number of rows and columns.

      This method sets up the grid for the game field, creates all cells, randomly places bombs, calculates adjacent bomb counts for each cell, and adds the cells to the grid layout.

      Parameter:
      rows - The number of rows in the game field.
      columns - The number of columns in the game field.

    • initializeGameFieldGridPane

      private void initializeGameFieldGridPane()
      Initializes the GridPane layout for the game field.

      This method creates a new GridPane, centers its alignment, applies styles, and configures column and row constraints to ensure all cells are evenly distributed.

    • countAdjacentBombs

      private int countAdjacentBombs(int row, int col)
      Counts the number of bombs adjacent to a specified cell.

      This method checks all neighboring cells within a 3x3 grid around the given cell's position (including diagonals) and counts how many of them contain bombs.

      Parameter:
      row - The row index of the cell to check.
      col - The column index of the cell to check.
      Gibt zurück:
      The number of adjacent cells containing bombs.

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds(int row, int col)
      Checks whether a specified cell position is within the bounds of the game field.
      Parameter:
      row - The row index of the cell to check.
      col - The column index of the cell to check.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the cell is within the bounds of the game field; false otherwise.

    • getCellAt

      public Cell getCellAt(int row, int col)
      Retrieves the cell at the specified row and column in the game field.
      Parameter:
      row - The row index of the cell to retrieve.
      col - The column index of the cell to retrieve.
      Gibt zurück:
      The Cell at the specified position.
      Löst aus:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified row or column is out of bounds.

    • formatTime

      private String formatTime(int time)
      Formats the given time as a three-digit string.

      This method ensures that the time is always displayed with at least three digits, padding with leading zeros if necessary.

      Parameter:
      time - The time value to format (in seconds).
      Gibt zurück:
      A three-digit string representation of the time.

    • formatCounter

      private String formatCounter(int count)
      Formats the given counter value as a string with leading zeros.

      This method handles both positive and negative values. Positive numbers are displayed as three digits with leading zeros, while negative numbers include a leading minus sign and are displayed as two digits with leading zeros after the minus sign.

      Parameter:
      count - The counter value to format.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string representation of the counter, formatted with leading zeros.

    • getRandomWinJingle

      private String getRandomWinJingle()
      Generates a random win jingle filename.

      This method randomly selects between two win jingles, returning the filename of either "win-jingle-1" or "win-jingle-2".

      Gibt zurück:
      A string representing the filename of a randomly chosen win jingle.

    • getRandomLoseJingle

      private String getRandomLoseJingle()
      Generates a random lose jingle filename.

      This method randomly selects between two lose jingles, returning the filename of either "lose-jingle-1" or "lose-jingle-2".

      Gibt zurück:
      A string representing the filename of a randomly chosen lose jingle.

    • getRandomBombExplosionSound

      private String getRandomBombExplosionSound()
      Generates a random bomb explosion sound filename.

      This method randomly selects between two bomb explosion sounds, returning the filename of either "bomb-explosion-1" or "bomb-explosion-2".

      Gibt zurück:
      A string representing the filename of a randomly chosen bomb explosion sound.

    • setGameInfoBox
